column4: Hi everyone, X fails to start from the feisty installer disc (even in safe graphics mode) on my rather new HP core 2 duo laptop
pretty common. use alternate install cd
or of course alt-ctrl-f2 login then type sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg  and choose vesa as your driver
Darn.  (I would use a much stronger word).  I don't have any spare CDRs with me.. why wouldn't the most widely used disc work? :[
then sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart
should be workable in livecd. i dont have much exp with it though
thanks, i'll try that
even vesa didn't work
what the heck
does x crash or just a black screen?
x crashes
i'm tryin to read the crash report to see if there is anything useful in here
this an intel or ati or nvidia or what?
ati x1600 pro
im sorry i have little exp with ati. either the open drivers or closed
they are as a rule problematic. nvidia is as a rule flawless for regular use
are any drivers loaded for the live cd start??
!ati | tamale
that might help. you can sudo apt-get install whatever package you need in livecd. sorry not more help
I'm nowhere near having networking or anything like that.. i'm just booting the install disc.. heh
hardline or wireless network
i'm on a hard line
you mean to tell me i can install ATI drivers before ever even booting?
